wizard.title: Setup Wizard
wizard.description: Configure your Auto Claude environment in a few simple steps
wizard.helpText: This wizard will help you set up your environment in just a few steps. You can configure your Claude OAuth token, set up memory features, and create your first task.

welcome.title: Welcome to Auto Claude
welcome.subtitle: Build software autonomously with AI-powered agents

aiPowered.title: AI-Powered Development
aiPowered.description: Generate code and build features using Claude Code agents

specDriven.title: Spec-Driven Workflow
specDriven.description: Define tasks with clear specifications and let Auto Claude handle the implementation

memory.title: Memory & Context
memory.description: Persistent memory across sessions with Graphiti

parallel.title: Parallel Execution
parallel.description: Run multiple agents in parallel for faster development cycles

oauth.title: Claude Authentication
oauth.description: Connect your Claude account to enable AI features
oauth.keychainDescription: Your tokens are encrypted using your system's keychain. You may see a password prompt from macOS — click "Always Allow" to avoid seeing it again.
oauth.rateLimitInfo: Add multiple Claude subscriptions to automatically switch between them when you hit rate limits.
oauth.tokenSetupInstructions: Run claude setup-token to get your token
oauth.authenticatedSuccess: You have at least one authenticated Claude account. You can continue to the next step.

memory.title: Memory
memory.description: Configure persistent cross-session memory for agents
memory.contextDescription: Auto Claude Memory helps remember context across your coding sessions
memory.enableMemoryDescription: Persistent cross-session memory using LadybugDB (embedded database)
memory.memoryDisabledInfo: Memory is disabled. Session insights will be stored in local files only. Enable Memory for persistent cross-session context with semantic search.
memory.enableAgentAccessDescription: Allow agents to search and add to the knowledge graph via MCP
memory.mcpServerUrlDescription: URL of the Graphiti MCP server for agent memory access
memory.embeddingProviderDescription: Provider for semantic search (optional - keyword search works without)
memory.memoryInfo: Memory stores discoveries, patterns, and insights about your codebase so future sessions start with context already loaded. No Docker required - uses an embedded database.
memory.configuredSuccessDesc: Memory features are enabled. Auto Claude will maintain context across sessions for improved code understanding.
memory.dbAutoCreateDesc: LadybugDB uses an embedded database - no Docker required. The database will be created when you first use memory features.
memory.graphitiDescription: Graphiti is an intelligent memory layer that helps Auto Claude remember context across sessions. It uses a knowledge graph to store discoveries, patterns, and insights about your codebase.
memory.benefit2: Better understanding of your codebase over time
memory.benefit4: No Docker required - uses embedded database
memory.enableGraphitiDesc: Uses LadybugDB (embedded) and an LLM/embedding provider
memory.apiKeyValidationNote: Note: API key validation currently only fully supports OpenAI. Your key will be saved and used at runtime.
memory.ollamaNote: Note: Ollama connection will be tested by checking if the server is reachable.

completion.title: You're All Set!
completion.subtitle: Auto Claude is ready to help you build amazing software
completion.setupCompleteDescription: Your environment is configured and ready. You can start creating tasks immediately or explore the application at your own pace.

createTask.title: Create a Task
createTask.description: Start by creating your first task to see Auto Claude in action.

customizeSettings.title: Customize Settings
customizeSettings.description: Fine-tune your preferences, configure integrations, or re-run this wizard.

exploreDocs.title: Explore Documentation
exploreDocs.description: Learn more about advanced features, best practices, and troubleshooting.

completion.rerunHint: You can always re-run this wizard from Settings → Application

authChoice.title: Choose Your Authentication Method
authChoice.description: Select how you want to authenticate with Claude. You can change this later in Settings.

oauth.title: Sign in with Anthropic
oauth.description: Use your Anthropic account to authenticate. Simple and secure OAuth flow.

apiKey.title: Use Custom API Key
apiKey.description: Bring your own API key from Anthropic or a compatible API provider. Highly experimental — may incur significant costs.

authChoice.info: Both options provide full access to Claude Code features. Choose based on your preference.

privacy.title: Help Improve Auto Claude
privacy.subtitle: Anonymous error reporting helps us fix bugs faster

whatWeCollect.title: What we collect
whatWeCollect.crashReports: Crash reports and error stack traces

toggle.label: Send anonymous error reports
toggle.description: Help us identify and fix issues

claudeCode.title: Claude Code CLI
claudeCode.description: Install or update the Claude Code CLI to enable AI-powered features

info.title: What is Claude Code?
info.description: Claude Code is Anthropic's official CLI that powers Auto Claude's AI features. It provides secure authentication and direct access to Claude models.

install.success: Installation command sent to terminal. Please complete the installation there.
install.instructions: The installer will open in your terminal. Follow the prompts to complete installation.

devtools.title: Developer Tools
devtools.description: Choose your preferred IDE and terminal for working with Auto Claude worktrees
devtools.whyConfigureDescription: When Auto Claude builds features in isolated worktrees, you can open them directly in your preferred IDE or terminal to test and review changes.

ide.label: Preferred IDE
ide.description: Auto Claude will open worktrees in this editor

terminal.label: Preferred Terminal
terminal.description: Auto Claude will open terminal sessions here

devtools.noToolsDetected: No additional tools detected (VS Code and system terminal will be used)

notInstalled.title: Ollama not installed
notInstalled.description: Ollama provides free, local embedding models for semantic search. Install it with one click to enable this feature.
notInstalled.installSuccess: Installation started in your terminal. Complete the installation there, then click Retry.
notInstalled.fallbackNote: Memory will still work with keyword search even without Ollama.

notRunning.title: Ollama not running
notRunning.description: Ollama is installed but not running. Start Ollama to use local embedding models.
notRunning.fallbackNote: Memory will still work with keyword search even without embeddings.

firstSpecStep.title: Create Your First Task
firstSpecStep.description: Describe what you want to build and let Auto Claude handle the rest
firstSpecStep.successMessage: Great! You can create your first task now or continue with the wizard. You can always create tasks later from the main dashboard.

beDescriptive.title: Be Descriptive
beDescriptive.description: Clearly describe what you want to build. Include requirements, constraints, and expected behavior.

startSmall.title: Start Small
startSmall.description: Begin with a focused task like adding a feature or fixing a bug. Smaller tasks are easier to verify.

includeContext.title: Include Context
includeContext.description: Mention relevant files, APIs, or patterns. The more context you provide, the better the results.

letAiHelp.title: Let AI Help
letAiHelp.description: The AI can generate titles and classify tasks. Focus on describing what you want, not the details.

firstSpecStep.exampleDescription: "Add a dark mode toggle to the settings page. It should persist the user's preference in localStorage and apply the theme immediately without page reload. Use the existing color variables in styles/theme.css."
firstSpecStep.continueMessage: You can continue with the wizard now or create more tasks.
firstSpecStep.skipMessage: You can skip this step and create tasks later from the dashboard.
